nodes.bodyText: Is there anyway to make building cms easier? I don't need to know any RestTemplateClusterManagementServiceTransport, I don't need to know any BaseConnectionConfig, I just want to plug in the host and port.....

host and port can be set via system properties.
In this change all that I have done is made the transport explicit. I don't think there is anything wrong with exposing that there is a Transport and what kind of transport is being used.
What is incorrect is having multiple options on a Builder that if you incorrectly pick will cause failure, rather than an intuitive Builder where differences from "normal"  are handled as optional and there is a happy case.
what I mean is: is there a way to build a cms without having to know I need to construct a BaseConnectionConfig and a a RestTemplate....Transport.
I like the current state a lot better now.  The only request I have is to move this builder out of the internal package. It should be a public api.

nodes.bodyText: And I believe the cache needs to work on both client cache and server cache. You can refer back to the state of things before Jens made all the changes to the builder

nodes.bodyText:
And I believe the cache needs to work on both client cache and server cache. You can refer back to the state of things before Jens made all the changes to the builder

The GeodeConnectionConfig works for both client and Server.
If you look at the GeodeConnectionConfig constructor, you will see that we process the cache as either a client cache or server cache. This way the decision point / code is only in the config, where it belongs.
Please let me know if you feel this is not sufficient.
